page.title: 16Home Life
page.content: Most of the older houses in the area would be built of limestone quarried locally.There was a quarry in Islip off Mill Street,where there is now a private house called The Grange.Many of these houses were once farm or other labourers' cottages bought up after the '39-'45 war and greatly improved by their new and more affluent owners about the time when many new houses including Council Houses were built.Each village therefore contains a good selection of new and old houses all of which have made very comfortable homes.Most are served by mains electricity,water and sewerage,and contain an electric cooker,refrigerator,freezer,and washing machine,plus television,probably a video and the usual domestic cleaning appliances.There are no mansions.
